Reviews.Title: “clean but bad location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy G
Reviews.Content: After review of tripadvisor, I asked to have a room away from the railway. It's face to the road but not really noisy. The location is not good. About 15mins walk to the central station. 20 mins walk to the central bus station(access to all buses and free shuttle bus). 25 mins walk to haymarket (city&chinatown). It's not really safe if walking a long way in the area during the night. Room is very small like a cell but you have your own bath room. Very clean and provide free brekky buffet. Besides from location, it's a good place to stay in syd. The nearest bus stop is 750m away. They also provide free luggage keep. The other good thing is we checked in at 10am (should be after 2pm) but no other charges. I won't stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: ChMBK
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small and the bathroom was the smallest that we have seen during our half year of travelling. Also the bed was shorter then normally â€“ it was too short for a comfortable sleep for people over 170cm. Apart of this we liked the place. It was clean and in a good location: away from the hustle and bustle in the centre but only a 5 minute walk to the next train station (Redfern) or a 10 minute walk to the central station. It's just beside the railway lines, so take your earplugs with you, if you don't have a deep sleep. There is a breakfast buffet in the morning. And there is a washing machine in the ground floor so that if you need, you can do your laundry by yourself (around 3 AUD), which we found great! Even if it's not cheap at all it seems to be one of the better budget options in expensive Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Strange 'apartment'.”
Reviews.Author: Lizinozz
Reviews.Content: I rented this apartment with two friends for a short trip to Sydney. The apartment is large and reasonably clean with comfy beds. However it feels like it is converted staff accommodation as it is filled with excessive numbers of cupboards and shelves as if it used to be an office. For the amount charged it really should be upgraded to a proper apartment for guest use. Not good value for money and poorly represented on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Ok budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel is basic but good for travellers on a budget. Hotel not in the best area but easy to travel to minutes from redden station. Room was small but clean bed comfortable. Would stay again of travelling on a budget. Free breakfast a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Budget traveller not wanting to stay at a Backpackers”
Reviews.Author: antandgoose
Reviews.Content: I have just gotten back from Sydney after staying 4 nights and 5 days. I booked the Y City South after alot of searching for a decent hotel within my budget. I didnt want to stay at a Backpackers this time around, so I landed on this hotel. The reviews on the hotel are pretty much true. Sydney Accomodation is expensive! So you cant expect much if you are not willing to pay for it. The photos that you can find on here and other parts of the internet are the same as what I would be putting up here. I arrived early, and even though my room wasnt ready, but there is a room for my luggage - free of charge. Fantastic! Allthough they do just let people in the room, so I would keep a lock on your luggage. The hotel is walking distance to Central Station, but closer to Redfern. Although from Central, you can either catch a train closer into town, the free loop bus, or the City Sightseeing tour. On arrival to my room, the first thing I thought was "Boy it IS small. The Double bed was against the wall, and the space in between the other was just enough to fit my suitcase in without tripping over it. It has a desk, a kettle, hair dryer, iron and board, a bar fridge, a tv (digital, no cable, and not all of the channels are connected), your own toilet and shower, towels, and complimentary soaps and coffee / sugar / milk sachets. The bathroom is small, and as a bigger person, I would have preferred a bit more room, but it did the job. In saying all of this, if you are like me, I use my hotel room to store my luggage and sleep in. If I wanted to be in my hotel room for the entire day, I would have made sure that I got a more expensive option. I woke up, got ready, came back, went to sleep. And it was fine. The housekeepers make up your room during the day. Bed and towels only. But make sure you check under your bed when you leave. I found a pair of my shoes! Breakfast is cereal and toast. If you want a hot breakfast there are numerous cafes in town or a 5-10 minute walk away. Breakfast should really stay open until checkout though, 9.30 is just not long enough. BBQ and rooftop area was closed for renovations, so I cant comment. I know on some sites it says that they have a Gym, but it was nowhere in sight. I was running a tad late and checked out a 10 on the dot, but there was a few people after me and they had no problems either. There was a staff member who was a bit sleazy, and I tried to steer clear of him at all costs. He was very unprofessional and it wasn't a good look for the hotel. The other staff were friendly but not over welcoming. I would stay there again, but I would try and look for a nicer option first!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Esker4
Reviews.Content: I liked my stay in the Y Hotel much better than my stay at the Travelodge. The Y Hotel room was small but clean and comfortable, and breakfast was good. The location was great (the City South one is near Sydney Uni), and you can easily walk to cafes and restaurants in almost any direction. It is best, however, if you don't need any help from the staff; they give wrong and conflicting information.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: xoz
Reviews.Content: The name should convey the full story Y (MCA) If your expectations are a very basic and extremely small room, with a hard bed and a ensuite that you can't close the door once inside - then this place is for you. Dont pay for parking and then expect to have a reserved spot - no system in place to insure this. Breakfast? VERY basic - but OK. Cereal, toast, Tea & Coffee - OK I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget!”
Reviews.Author: jekko12
Reviews.Content: I was also a bit concerned about staying at the Y City South after having read some of the Tripadvisor reviews and having heard that the Redfern neighborhood was a bit on the rougher end but everything went just fine during our 5 day stay here. We got in a bit earlier than check-in time and they already had a room open for us. The rooms are definitely the smallest I have ever stayed in but the bed was comfortable enough and the toilets were clean. There is a railroad track on one side of the hotel but we could not hear any trains with the window closed from the opposite side. The hotel has very affordable wi-fi ($10 a day or $25 for a week, I think) that has a decent connection speed and good signal. There are laundry facilities in the hotel for $2-3 per wash and dry and the hotel has a (limited) breakfast. It was definitely more comfortable than I expected and I am sure that you cannot get anything cheaper with as much cleanliness and comfort in the Sydney central area. Walk from the station was about 10minutes with a nice walk through Prince Alfred park which is safe even at night.

Reviews.Title: “good recomendation”
Reviews.Author: NihalPeeris
Reviews.Content: very good hotel ,convenient to city center ,staff very helpful,value for money only breakfast has little choice

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in Y Hotel City South, Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Jess Lay G
Reviews.Content: Dear Chuck, Firstly, the cancellation policy is unfair to its customers, at least for me. I did not know that I have to give a hotel 48 hours of move/ check-out notice. This is the FIRST ever hotel in the world that I come across with such unreasonable policy. I was not told at check-in day about this policy or when booking. Also, as for the definition of cancellation, it does not fit for my case, as I did not cancel the booking, but I stayed one night there. And, was charged for a service (2nd night) that I did NOT receive. As a consumer/customer, we do not pay for service not received. Most importantly, please allow me the reason I had to move out of the hotel. The hotel air conditioning is NOT maintain at all. Hygiene standard in the hotel is very poor! I was coughing non-stop and having allergic (could NOT even sleep!) for the entire night, caused by the mold, bacteria, debris and particles emitting by the air conditioner. I DO NOT want to be infected with Legionellosis, a fatal infectious disease that killed a group of people attended the convension of American Legion in 1976 due to the Legionella bacteria from dirty and unserviced air conditioning. To me, it is the responsibility of Y Hotel to maintain its air conditioning system and provide clean air for its customers, but this is not being fulfilled at all by Y Hotel. And, it is a law in USA for every commercial place (including hotels) to have their air conditioning and cooling systems be serviced and cleaned periodically. Is this not in Australia? (Attached photos of Y Hotel air conditioning with thick layers of dust, debris, particles and mold inside the duct). Also, I had to see a doctor to get medication for the allergy caused by the polluted air emitted from the air conditioning. I had to fork out medical fees after staying one night in such a dirty hotel. So, do you think the hotel should compensate my medical fees instead? So, I am questioning if this policy still apply for my case. I am unlucky that I had to pay one night for the nightmare in Y Hotel but I am NOT willing to pay for the additional night that I did not stay (and will not ever stay!). Regards. Lay

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location and cost. I wanted to be near one of the city's train station, and the hotel is located near both Central Station and Redfern station. I also needed to budget wisely, and if you don't know, Sydney is a very expensive city. From what I hear and discovered first hand, it is the most expensive city in all of Australia. From these two necessities, I decided on this hotel. Location: The hotel is actually closer to Redfern station than to Central. Redfern station is a 5 minute walk, and it's really just 1 long block. Central is about 15 minutes away, walking, and can be a bit daunting at first. There's a lot of vehicle traffic and not as much foot traffic. So you may be a bit intimidated by the lack of pedestrians and worry about your safety. I wouldn't advise walking from the hotel to Central, or vice versa, at night. In my opinion, Redfern is the wiser choice. There is actually a police station right across the street from the train station. Plus there is a lot of car traffic so you don't feel alone when walking the one block. It's faster and the station is less hectic than Central. I actually was walking from the station to the hotel after midnight and it was perfectly fine. In fact, there were police cars doing random alcohol testing at that time, so it couldn't have been safer. Hotel Service: You get what you pay for. If you're looking for conceirge service, room service, or great service, you will not find it here. The staff will help you, but you have to ask them. And oftentimes repeatedly. They'll give you this look as if they're paying you and not the other way around, but they will work with you. You just have to be patient. I found the cleaning staff to be a lot friendlier than the people behind the reception desk. Just don't expect a lot of bells and whistles here. Again, you get what you pay for. Complimentary Breakfast: Syndey is expensive. If you can save a buck here and there, you can really use it during your outings. One of the things I liked about the hotel was the free breakfast. Nothing fancy, but it's free. You get unlimited coffee, juice (orange or apple), cereal (6 types), bread/toast. I spend about 30 minutes there each morning filling up. This way, I only get something to drink if I'm thirsty during the day, and then I have the chance to really splurge on dinner. I end up only having to pay for one meal a day. Just to highlight how expensive things are in Sydney. An average sandwich in the United States with drink and chips included may run you about $8. In Sydney, you're looking at $12 minimum. Room: Ok it's small. There's no denying that. But for 1 person, I was ok being in the double room. While I was there, there was a couple with a baby trying to get a larger room. Turns out, they couldn't fit their luggage, their crib, and the stroller into the room. They eventually got a bigger room, but they still had to leave their stroller out in the hallway. My room was small, but adequate. I at least had the room to myself, a bathroom that I didn't have to share, and the AC worked which is very important during the muggy Spring season. The walls are a bit thin, so when people in neighboring rooms decided to party late into the night, you get to experience the fun, whether you wanted to or not. I was on the 2nd floor, and the tracks were right below. I had asked for the quietest room possible, but I ended up facing the tracks. No way my room was the quietest in the building. I could have asked to be switched, but I was too tired from my flight and I didn't want to cause problems, so I let it slide. But it turned out that the train didn't really bother me. I'm a very sound sleeper, and usually the day's events would tire me out so that I pretty much passed out. Also the trains stop running a little past midnight and don't start up again til early morning, so you get to sleep soundly through. Other points: The hotel is not very clean. You'll notice the discolored hallway rugs, the streaks on the walls, the old furniture, etc. There's a laundry room down in the basement/garage. It cost $3 AU to wash (30 min) and $3 AU to dry (60 min). There's a microwave downstairs in the dining area, but I think they put it away after the breakfast is over. Not really sure, but I don't remember seeing it after breakfast. Overall, I was satisfied with my stay at the hotel. I had a lot to do while I was there and I didn't want to stress over my lodgings. I got what I paid for, I was well rested, and I started the day with a full stomach. Would I stay there again? If I could find a hotel closer to downtown at a decent price, then I'd stay somewhere else. But if I'm on a tight budget and taking public transit, then I'd consider staying here again. It's really not that bad. Not that good either, but not bad. Honest. The front desk staff could use a refresher course on customer service though. Seriously.

Reviews.Title: “For the budget traveler, definitely worth it....”
Reviews.Author: BfromUSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Y South in Sydney back in May for 5 days. If you are on a tight budget and you've done your homework about the cost of travel, food, lodging etc in Sydney and Australia in general, you will appreciate this place highly for the price (If you haven't done your homework...believe me, it's expensive in Australia!!) You cannot really complain about anything due to how low, I paid just under $60 for a room for 2 and in Sydney, that is half+ less than most every place else. I don't know about you, but for myself, I don't spend a lot of time in my room...I use it for sleeping and prepping myself to get out there and suck in as much as I can...so I don't need anything fancy or frilly, just a place I can lay my head after spending all day on the go. It is near the rail station (within 5 minutes walking) and the tracks are right next to the Y, so if you don't like the sound of trains passing every so often, you wont like it here. The continental breakfast was a welcome thing, just what I needed: some cereal, coffee, juice and toast & jam. The staff were very friendly too. Take a trip up to the rooftop area and look around too! The location is not right in the heart of Sydney...in order to get to the Harbour you need to take the train....so if you like to be in the thick of things, this place is not for you either. To sum it all up: if you are the type that just needs a bed to rest your head after a long day of sightseeing, a free quick breakfast to revitalize, want to save a good chunk of dough for more important things and a bathroom and shower to prep for another long day....then definitely check this out. *and just to clarify, my ratings are based on what you get for the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not my worst experience but would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: oxjohnnysangelxo
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location is OK. About 10 minute walk to Redfern train station or you can walk about 20 minutes to Central Station. If you're looking for a hotel closer to the center then this isn't for you. Wifi was a decent price - $25 for the week unlimited wifi and we didn't have any problems with that. Free breakfast (although it really is just toast/jam and cereals) Cons: Room was about the size of a prison cell. While in London I actually stayed in a hostel that was a former prison so I can tell you - this was about the same. My husband got sick while here and I'm convinced it was due to the dirtiness of the rooms. There was no ventilation in the room. TV was fuzzy with maybe 3 channels that worked a bit. Walls are thin as I could hear a baby crying at the other end of the hall. Bathroom is made for tiny people - shower was too short for both my husband and I (He is 6'2 and I'm 5'7). If you sit on the toilet you cannot stick your arms out so good luck grabbing the toilet paper. The free breakfast was OK however the staff always started putting things away earlier than scheduled. I got the impression that the staff is lazy - the cleaning person huffed once as we left our room and put the "Please make-up room" sign on the door. Most hotels the cleaning staff does several rounds until about 2 or 3pm to make sure they can clean as many rooms as possible. The reception person was never actually at the desk - you always had to push the bell to get them to stop playing their music in the back so they can come up and assist you. They aren't unpleasant, however do barely the minimum required of their jobs. And the fact that the breakfast staff cleans up too soon despite people trying to even just grab a cup of coffee or tea. We ended up moving to a different hotel within Sydney(Devere Hotel) and had a much better experience and miraculously my husband was no longer sick. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry, but I can't give higher than 1/5”
Reviews.Author: Sendmeatelex
Reviews.Content: First I want to say that the staff were great and helpful and I'm sure you can't really expect to much of this kind of hotel. But still, I can't help but being disappointed. First of all the hotel isn't cheap, so you expect things to be of a certain standard. Second, it's quite a long walk from everywhere, both the city centre with China town, Newtown and Surry hills are a long walk away. Third, the room is so small it's like a prison cell. A prison cell with a tv that doesn't work, that is. Fourth, it's situated between a large road and the railroad tracks, so you've pretty much got a 24 hour buzz from cars and trains. All in all, I can't give this hotel any higher grade that 1. I would recommend others to just pay a little bit extra to avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “location and price!”
Reviews.Author: HodaJ
Reviews.Content: rooms are too small, if you are going to stay a lot in the room, I would not recommend it. You can walk to the city and central station

Reviews.Title: “If you stay here you will be mauled by bedbugs and the staff will not care”
Reviews.Author: Mezza255093
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and it was one of the worst experiences of my life. The room was utterly infested with bedbugs and I was mauled by them. The staff were rude and dismissive. DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “not get close to this hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hagoela
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Not recommended at all!! True it's cheaper but because he's a distant 20 minutes from the center. He is on many railways in our window turned toward making a constant noise from 6 am to 11 pm. The desk clerk was not nice at all and did not want to help us. The area of the hotel is not so sympathetic, so we just slept and we approached him all day! I recommend paying a little more money, everything was perfect in Sydney outside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “claustrophobic !!! the size of a prison cell !!”
Reviews.Author: grace051
Reviews.Content: The rooms are tiny, it is like staying in a box... I have travelled to throughout the world from Asia to Europe and have stayed in some pretty bad places, but this is Australia your hotel room shouldnt be the size of a prison cell... We had to leave after one night because the size and tiny window just made our stay claustrophobic and depressing. The location is also in quite a dodgy area.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daftrade
Reviews.Content: The location is about 15 minutes to the Sydney Central Station on foot. It could be longer with luggage. Situated just beside train tracks that you can hear the noise of the train from your room if you are lucky (or not :D). Nothing much on its surrounding. Some bars, convenient stores and small restaurants are on the way from the Central Station. Quite a quiet place that I always try to go back to hotel before dark. If you are going to see University of Sydney, it's about 10-15 minutes walk down the road. The catch of this hotel is its price, the free breakfast and location. Although to me, other hotels could have been in the better location than this. The breakfast is quite helpful, considering Sydney is quite an expensive place. Free flow of bread, jams, juice, milk and cereals, from 6/7 to 10 am. I often see people brought their breakfast to their rooms. The hotels has a lift, vending machine, computer terminals for rent, internet using pre-paid card, and free luggage room. In appearance, the hotel is good enough. It allows early check-in if the room is ready. It's very helpful for us, who just had a long journey from Melbourne on train which took around 9 hours. We chose a double room for 2 ppl, with queen size bed. The room is quite small and compact. It's really hard to move around if you have lots of luggage. The furniture is basic. It has a cupboard, corner table, hanging TV, AC, a chair, hairdryer, iron, coffee making facilities. The wall is not clean, with some dark marks on. Yet, it does not really bother us. The toilet is small, just enough because we are Asians. The cleanliness is medium. The shower is good, plenty of hot water. Complementary toiletries were available. The towels are clean enough. The bed sheet is also clean. The sound proofing is... medium. We can still hear the noise from outside, yet not so disturbing. Or probably because we were tired enough to care about it. And, at night, we can smell a funny smell like pesticide in the room. Not sure if it is deliberately provided or smell from outside. All in all, it's an okay hotel. Not so disappointing for its price. But, if there is a similar hotel closer to the central station I would prefer the closer one.

Reviews.Title: “Good For Sydney and Close to Enmore Theatre”
Reviews.Author: ToniBee
Reviews.Content: Difficult Location to find specially if you are from out of the city. There is very limited parking under the hotel which comes at an extra $10. Stayed in A twin room, No-12 on 1st floor. Room clean and Tidy,with kettle fridge, and nice tv. Only downside is there is little space, rooms are very compact. Lift access to floors. The roof has a BBQ, picnic tables and chairs, and smoking area. The other downside to this Hotel is that it is on the edge of a railway track with trains regularly going past. However there is not much accomodation in this area and we were going to a show at The Enmore Theatre which is a couple of Blocks away and not with in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “For the money - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: spacedotstop
Reviews.Content: I got in late on Friday night to find the place locked. This was a good start, at least knowing it is secure! While the guy at the reception gave me incorrect information about the laundry, was ok. The room was small, it was great for what I needed. My room was right next to the railway tracks but with the double windows, I could hardly hear a thing. The shower needed a good clean as the corners and railing under the door were filthy. However, generally ok. I am a tall guy and the shower head was really low at below my shoulder height (I am 6'3") The next day I had to change rooms as a friend was arriving and I was to move to a twin share room. I was going out before my friend arrived so I asked to confirm the room and all was good. This was about 9am. The room at this time was already ready and the reception guy was really helpful. When we arrived later that night, we got into the room and immediately the blind cord snapped. I advised the reception (as I didn't want to be charged for breaking it) and they offered to change my room for me. We didn't bother as we were going out that night and would sleep through the morning light anyway! The laundry was good with a number of washers. The rooftop would be a fun place for a bit of a party! If you love trains, this is the place for you as it is next to the busy Redfern to Cental line. It is also near a not-so-nice part of Sydney but I walked from Central to the hotel at 11pm and had not one trouble. All in all, I thought it was good and if I need to, I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It's okay if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: bourboncatt
Reviews.Content: I got a cheap deal on the net so it worked out at about 70 bucks a night which was really good value but I wouldn't pay any more. I thought the location was handy but if you have a car parking can be an issue as the hotel car park is always full. Breakfast is pretty average and rooms are so so tiny but for 70 dollars a night it is really good value

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad budget option but right by the train tracks”
Reviews.Author: iheartaus
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it was super cheap and that's exactly what we wanted! Like the other reviews on TP have said, the rooms are really small although not as tiny as I was expecting. We had a double and there was just enough room to squish in a small desk, TV and cupboard. We had an opening window which was nice although right outside are the train tracks so a train rumbles by every few minutes! If you are sensitive to noise it could be a problem but it didn't bother me. The rooms are pretty old and the walls are quite dirty - there is no luxury about this place so don't expect it but for a place to crash it does the job. We used the self-service laundry downstairs and found it to be good value and never busy. Redfern station is definetly closer but Central is only about 10 minutes walk away. I wouldn't say location was a selling point. The free breakfast was an added bonus though.

Reviews.Title: “I was bitten by bed bugs and had to fight for a refund.”
Reviews.Author: jstarVictoria
Reviews.Content: Rooms and everything were fine for the price...however woke to find a bed bug crawling on my neck. Demanded a refund from reception who said I'd have to wait until monday and call the manager. Called and eventually received refund, but not given a satisfactory apology. Have around 10 very swollen itchy bites around arms, chest and neck.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DanfromAus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times now and always find it a good place to stay when on a budget. The most recent I booked online with lastminute and got a rate of AU$65 per night. The rooms are very small, but clean. Nothing special about them at all but good if you need a place to just sleep. The Bed was comofortable and even though I had a single room it was a double size bed and comfortable. The bathroom is also very small but adequite. I liked the free toiletry bag they give you as well. Location is great, just on the edge of the CBD about 8-10min walk from central and even closer to redfern station although it can get a little seedy at night. Being as i used to live in Sydney this wasn't an issue for me though. And a cab ride from the hotel to the city would be very cheap, maybe $10. The only complaint I would have about the location is that it is that there isn't much choice for food nearby. A Go Gas station with a small asain take away is just down the road but other than that a 10min walk to broadway is probably the closest for food options. Service was fine and the staff seemed friendly enough, but not really personal at all. I would definitely reccomend this hotel for short stays, maybe not the best for a longer stay just because the rooms are small, but all in all great value for money in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap accomodation close to the city”
Reviews.Author: kiki-cukoo
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a little cautious, but booked anyway. Honestly, it is not nearly as bad as the reviews say. One reviewer said it took them "over half an hour" to get to central. Thats completely untrue. It takes 7-10 minutes max. It is slightly annoying that only one bus goes down cleveland street though. Anyway, room was clean, had a desk, chair, kettle, coffee, tea, hairdryer, iron, ironing board, vanity pack, everything you would expect from a budget hotel. The free breakfast was from 630-930 an had all types of cereal, and toast with spreads, juices and coffee and tea. I had no problems with this hotel. The only thing I would say is that I did notice that the internet "vouchers" seem to have sold out quickly (I used my iphone so it didnt bother me), and the noise from the train line next door was a little noisy, which was fine for me, but for light sleepers maybe not the best. It's a decent budget hotel really close to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a life-time experience!”
Reviews.Author: HarryPotterFinal
Reviews.Content: The first amazing thing was the parking space. It was so narrow and squeezy. If you stay here with a car, you must get your car insured. The information available at the reception was amazingly brief. I wanted to have access to the Internet Friday night, but I was told at the reception that I should come back on Monday! The last amazing thing was that water started dripping onto the pillow from the airconditioner. I wanted to report this to the reception immediately, but there was no information about the number except for a 1800 number in my room. So I had to use my mobile phone to report it to the reception. Then I was told that there was a queen-size room but had no bath room. This was a fantastic accommodation. If you wish to experience a-once-in-a-life-time exprerience in Sydyeny. I recommend Y Holtel City South without any hesitation. I will change your world.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Nin70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as portrayed on its website. The service was horrible. There is only one person at the front desk and has limited time for each person. Customer service was brief, abrupt and sticklers. They don't think about the long term consequences of their actions. They are only there to get paid and then clock out. If they are kind and helpful then this will be passed on by word of mouth which will increase their business. But they will only get one time only guests who book here by accident. I paid for internet access. The internet was not running. So tried it later. Then asked to present a voucher? I was never given a voucher. How would I even know to ask for a voucher or to say why did i not get one. I didn't know. I spoke to the manager and he said "You lost it and now you will have to pay again" He kept using the word "You" and continued to blame me. Awful customer service. It is not as if I used the internet it was not working and he was fully aware of it. But they are so by the book and have no understanding that there are exceptions. They need customer service training immediately! I then found out that the elevator was not running. I had to lift my 50lb suitcase up for flights of stairs. The room was tinier than a prison cell. And a prison cell would have a larger window than in this hotel. By the way this hotel is formerly the YMCA, which explains a lot. The floor had rug stains. There was no way I was going to sleep there. I called a friend of a friend and left without staying that night. I will be disputing the charge. They did not provide what they promised.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "hotel" ever...”
Reviews.Author: jocobo
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend were needing just one nights accommodation to crash after a work christmas party. All of the usual nice hotels were booked out, so we decided to try the Y Hotel - close to the city, transport etc... NOT!! We were horrified at the condition and INconvenience of the place. It took us over half an hour for the "short walk" from Central station. Originally we had booked the apartment room, with 2 bedrooms, spacious bathroom and kitchen facilities. However there was a "plumbing issue" with the room and it wouldn't be ready on time, so we agreed to settle for 2 other rooms that were next to each other. OMG, we should never had checked in. The rooms were TINY and SMELLED musty, it hadn't been cleaned, the hinges on the shower door were broken, the water leaked out onto the carpet while showering (yes we did eventually brave the shower, only because we were running late!), and we didn't even want to touch the bed. After the party we checked out (this was about 2am) and made our own way home... all the way to Penrith! Even us westies thought it was totally disgusting and unacceptable. AND we paid $250 for this crap!!! If you are thinking about staying here, you are better off going to a real hostel for $20/night. At least it'll be clean and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: NaTuSmE
Reviews.Content: When we first booked a room with this 'hotel', my friends and I were looking at all these gorgeous photos of their rooms. We thought it looked nice to stay at, so we booked the two bedroom suite which supposedly had it's own balcony and etc. It said it was only a short walk from Central station... which then we noticed we were pretty much above Redfern station. We entered this establishment and the lobby looked ok, but they then told us that our room wasn't avaliable and they would give us a different one. What we got instead of a gorgeous two bedroom suite was 2 discusting, pest-filled, uncleaned, small rooms. We were so annoyed at the state of this room, that we didn't even stay the night! We only used it to get ready to attend an event. It was a pretty hot day and it was stuffy in our horrible rooms so we tried to turn on the air conditioner to cool it down, but there was a small sign on the wall telling us that if we turn it to a cold setting, it would cause the air-con to freeze and WE would have to pay for repairs! Also, when we attempted to use the shower, it told us to make sure the shut the bathroom door otherwise it will set off the fire alarms and WE would have to pay $250 for them to come out! And if we had to use the discusting kettle, we had to boil it in the bathroom as that would have also set off the fire alarms! This hotel would have to be the BIGGEST waste of money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: eerzaweepieanbovril
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this place got some other " Not Bad" reviews, it's a dump, rooms are tiny and not clean we wouldn't even walk on the carpets or take a shower without footwear on. At least we had a door on our washroom which is more than others had, don't be fooled by the pictures on the website or outside the hotel, still trying to figure out where they came from and we were told on more than one occasion not to go out after dusk alone in this area. If you're looking for a good point the roof top patio is fine with BBQ's , tables and a kitchen but do yourself a favour , spent an extra $20 per night and get a real hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: rockabella9
Reviews.Content: LIKES: - Cheap (paid $80 per night for an en suite double room) - Close to the city attractions (Redfern station was about 5 mins' walk from the hotel, just 1 stop away from Central station and a few stops from Circular Quay and Town Hall stations) - Modern and cheery furnishings - Clean and well-serviced - TV (even though with just a few channels, but enough to keep us entertained in the evenings) - Rate included a basic breakfast (bread, butter, vegemite, various jams, various cereals, juice, etc). Nothing fancy, but we enjoyed it anyway and it was a great start to the day. - Staff generally helpful and friendly. - Nice set of complimentary toiletries. - Quiet even though next to railway track. DISLIKES: - Room and ensuite bathroom were very small and may trigger slight claustrophobia. There was barely any walking space. Perhaps they shouldn't have built in a wardrobe and put in writing desk and chair to free up more space.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Experience”
Reviews.Author: useoh
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our son who lived nearby so chose this place for the location. Although we knew that at the price and the fact that it used to be the YWCA it wasn't going to be the most luxurious of rooms, it was a bit of a shock to see how small the room actually was. It was a bit of a challenge to manoeuvre around especially in the tiny bathroom. The fact that the bed was against the wall meant that one of us, (me) had to crawl over the bed to get out. The saving grace was the immaculate sheets and towels. The actual location of the hotel is quite good as it is a short walk to Redfern Railway Station where you can get to anywhere you really want. Although the area is classed as Redfern it isn't in the notorious part so is not really any different to any other old suburb of Sydney. There is a nice breakfast room with plenty of the basic breakfast items, the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a Gym and computer room with Internet for a small cost. There is also limited parking which needs to be booked but at $10 per night it is very good for Sydney. Once we had adjusted to the room size we found we quite enjoyed our stay here. The train noise was just a distant rumble which we hardly noticed. We are in our 60's and worried that there would be only youngsters staying here but that is not the case and there was the usual mix of hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “great location. close to all sights of sydney.”
Reviews.Author: weebles_8
Reviews.Content: train station 5mins walk from hotel. 2 stops from opera house/ harbour bridge. room was average. shared bathroom was ok. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super budget hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: gemmasnook
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Y Hotel South, our first impressions were of doubt, however once inside and in our room we were pleasantly surprised. The room is small but has everything you need and is everything you would expect from a budget city centre hotel. Our room looked on to the train line which was quite busy but the noise was minimal and my boyfriend who is a very light sleeper was not disturbed at all. Breakfast was included in the room rate and consists of unlimited cereal, toast, tea, coffee and fruit juice. The hotel is away from the main city centre but it is only a 5 minute walk to a very busy street lined with takeaways and restaurants, (I would reccommend Ali Baba's Lebanese Takeaway for a lovely Kebab!!). Once you have reached this street then its only another couple of minutes walk to catch the subway which will take you anywhere in Sydney. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone who was visiting Sydney on a budget but still wants a good quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming arms after a car accident”
Reviews.Author: terryomdahl
Reviews.Content: we arrived in sydney and had our car written of 5 minutes from our sons flat. we were devestated being 59 and 72 and then after that we arrived at our booked accomodation in a tow truck still in shock , nothing compared to when we saw our room(would not pass health and safety) awake allnight. We moved out next morning and found the y on the internet and rang them explained our circumstances and they said come straight over.As you can imagine we were still very shaky and sore and the receptionist guys were outstanding(we have been overseas several times and stayed at some pretty swank places we were always treated with every courtesy) but until you are in a situation like we were in you soon realize their is courtesty and their is genuine care. our room had a/c fridge/tv/kettle/window/bedside lightsensuite that we could actually have a shower in, and as one reviewer said comp toiletries. Breakfast was included and was quite sufficient you could have as much as you wanted. Helped with the internet to contact insurance and our doctors. some frozen meals available if not able to get out,quite allright for the price and convenience. clean towels very nice staff. I raise my glass to the whole experience we had at the Y. It is in a awkward place but we walked down to central station but do not recommend walking after dark. once again thank you to the guys and the girls at the y if you read this i hope you will remember us as surely as we remember you wishing you the very best. I cant remember all the names so i will not put one if i cannot put all by thank you very much and if we ever come your way again(i swore that we would never set foot in sydney ever again in our live but you never know) Our son has been transferred to Chicago U>S>A> . we will be recommending you to anyone we know going to Sydney. best to all robyn and russel from minden qld.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent budget choice of accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: PianoManiac
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 days at the Y City South for the sole purpose of attending the early stages of the Sydney International Piano Competition of Australia. The hotel is a very convenient 6-8 minute walk from Seymour Centre (Sydney University) where the piano recitals are held. The room I got was very spacious for one person, including double bed, en-suite facilities, fridge, ironing board, coffee/tea making facilities and television. The room overlooked busy railway tracks, but noise disturbance was not a big problem. A basic breakfast is served every morning â€“ toast, cereals, juice, milk, coffee/tea and Vegemite! Wi-fi is available at a small cost. Very important: hotel provides an airport shuttle service at $12, cheaper and more convenient than taking the railway. The hotelâ€™s clientele was mostly pilgrims (for World Youth Day) and fellow music-enthusiasts, generally a largely friendly bunch of people. Y City South is a 4-minute walk from Redfern Station, but that entails a walk through the ghetto-like Eveleigh Street, where homeless people may be found sleeping al fresco in the adjacent park. Taking the longer route would be a safer option at night. One could also walk to Central Station (8-10 min), and the delights of Chinatown and Haymarket (10-12 min) just further afoot. Nearby eating places: an acceptable Chinese takeout (within a service station, 2 min) and a Thai restaurant on Cleveland Street (4-6 min). All in all, an excellent budget choice of accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: MrStingely
Reviews.Content: I had the extreme misfortune of staying at the Y City South hotel in Sydney very recently. The experience was so bad that after three nights I had to checkout and move into the local hostel which I found to be a lot more comfortable and clean! Starting with the arrival, you can't actually get into the building without pressing a buzzer to notify reception. If somebody is not at the desk you can be stood there for a little while. Once you have your room key though you can actually use this to open the door. The hotel itself is nowhere near the city centre despite what it claims on their somewhat vague website. It is a good 15 minutes walk just to the train station and a good hour to the entertainment district and harbour. On the plus side taxis are quite cheap in Sydney but not after you have taken at least 4 rides a day! Upon entering my room the first thing I was greeted with was the beds not made and pulled into the middle of the room with the luggage rack and desk chair on the beds. The carpet had not been hoovered and the room smelt like it had not been entered for a few weeks. When checking out the bathroom I was greeted with the very unpleasant sight of cockroaches scuttling across the floor. I promptly asked to be moved rooms! The rooms are very compact and have loud air con systems which can be a pain during the night. There are no curtains either and the blinds only partially cut out the light. There is also only basic tv and no guest laundry services. Laundry is located in the basement where you will need to spend a few dollars just to use the washing machine. All in all this is a very poor hotel at best and should probably be classed as a hostel. But to be fair, as I said earlier, a hostel is actually better.

Reviews.Title: “Compact rooms but has everything. Friendly staff. 3 photos.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeHowe
Reviews.Content: I'd agree with the favorable review that this hotel gets on this site. The window in my room was double glazed so I found it very quiet. If you want to use your laptop there is a separate jackpoint for internet access at normal hotel phone rates. There are also spare power points for plugging in chargers/laptops etc. The continental breakfast was fine. Fruit juice, selection of cereals, toast, & a coffee machine. Staff very helpful & friendly. Here are 3 photos that will give you an idea of what a studio room looks like. Shower is small but work great. (not shown in bathroom photo.)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Alex1426
Reviews.Content: The Y hotel is a very nice budget hotel, with very friendly staff at the reception desk. Rooms are extremely clean and breakfast is OK. Maybe the ONLY negative thing to say is that is not in Sydney's CBD so you will have to take the train to get there. Nevertheless I highly recommend it! It's a budget hotel, it's clean and besides, when you stay at one of the Y Hotels you are helping with some of the programs the YWCA (Young Women Christian Association) holds to support women in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoamingTheGlobe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first night in Sydney. I had a single room, which was small, but comfortable. Room had a small refrigerator, hot water kettle with tea and coffee, TV and private bathroom. The complementary toiletries are wonderful, especially the lotion! Internet access is on the ground floor: $2.50 for 30 minutes if I remember correctly. Front desk and housekeeping staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Basic continental breakfast: cereal, toast with jam or butter, coffee, tea. The location is a bit of a walk from the center of the city, but not terrible. Overall, nice place for budget accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: pese
Reviews.Content: good value, small clean rooms, a bit on the side but still walking distance to all.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, clean hotel, just a bit out of the way!”
Reviews.Author: maz_n_gaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my fiancee during an extended holiday in Australia. This was the first place we stayed, and were pretty pleased with it overall - the only downside was that its about a 15 minute walk at a normal walking pace to get to central station - took us about 20 with our backpacks! The hotel itself is a really nice and modern building. There is a small gym with modern machines, although I didn't actually use it. The room was slightly smaller than average, but big enough for us, although one side of the (double) bed was up against the wall. Both the room and the ensuite were very clean. There was a nice rooftop BBQ area, although we didn't use this as it was a bit cold in July! Small internet rooms downside as well - quite cheap to use. My fiance complained about the noise of the traffic waking him up at night, but I didn't here a thing. Other than that the only bad thing about the hotel was the walk to central station, as you'd definately have to get the train (which was pretty cheap anyway) up to the harbours. I probably wouldn't stay here again, but only because of the distance, I loved the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not at all bad”
Reviews.Author: DGF69
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews, I stayed here on the first night of a three week holiday in Australia. (I was moving on from Sydney the next day.) I stayed in a single en suite room. It was fine and compact! They allowed me to check in early which was much appreciated after the flight from Ireland. The hotel is fine, but It's a good bit from other places. You'll need to master the public transport system. I stayed in Y on the Park for the final fews days when I was back in Sydney. I wish I returned to the Y Hotel City South.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and chic hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: brokenomerta
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just came back from a 10 day trip in Australia and we stayed in this hotel when we were in Sydney. Well, for starters, the hotel is located in where it says it is, in the city south. It's kinda far for walking distance from the main attractions of Sydney. But then again, my gf and I actually walked from Darling Harbour back to this hotel! Hahahaha...As for the interior of the hotel, well, it's clean and modern...they have a small but nice place downstairs for breakfast in the morning. And there is a microwave for us to heat up any food should you feel hungry in the middle of the night. As for the rooms, it's smaller than most hotel rooms that I have ever been but for the price you are paying, that's what you get, i assume...Clean bed and toilet...In short, I enjoyed my stay in this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Lou&Paulo
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money although location is not in the middle of the CBD it is a reasonable walk (20 mins) to the harbour. Lots of places to eat around the hotel. Staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help us with any requests, including travelling plans. Breakfast was fine (cereal and toast) although basic, as would be expected for the price. For cheaper rates don't book directly through the hotel. The only down side was the location being next to a railway track (although soundproofing was fine and the trains were fairly infrequent at night). The rooms are quite small too. This hotel is also a good loction for the airport and mascot area. The roof terrace is useful for smokers and chill out. Overall we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place!”
Reviews.Author: ClÃ¡udia
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the YHA City South in a double room with ensuite. The room was very small, but had all the necessary things, more than we expected of a youth hostel. Everything still looked quite new and clean. The breakfast was quite basic, but ok to start the day. This is a perfect place to stay if your aim is to explore Sydney, as you also have the train station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean, and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: I'd highly recommend this hotel as a budget hotel choice. The rooms are clean and compact, modern, with air conditioning. Bathrooms are great, with toiletries provided, and a modern shower. Breakfast was included in our stay and for the price we paid it was an outstanding deal!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap yet clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: arekAustralia
Reviews.Content: About 8 minutes walk from the Sydney Central Railway Station. Located on quite a busy intersection with cars and trains zipping nearby frequently, but then again, you are in the centre of Sydney. The hotel is surprisingly modern and perhaps more importantly, very clean. Perhaps a little smallish but i wasnt planning on living there permanently. Staff were welcoming... and actually pronounced my name quite well. The rooftop garden was in a pleasant setting and at night it became was a nice place to meet other guests for a bit of a chat. I actually expected less for the price....

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Noah Lodge Hotel is on the junction of Cleveland and Regent streets, about five minutes walk from Central train station. It is a good base from which to explore the centre of Sydney, and very reasonably priced, given it's location. It is a budget hotel, but is modern, well-equipped, clean and comfortable. The hotel's website says that the rooms are 'not overly large', which is true, however mine was easily large enough. The room was well equipped with everything I needed (en-suite and air conditioning were especially welcome) and was cleaned and tidied for me every day. My single gripe with this hotel was that the milk was left in a jug at room temperature in the dining area - I like cold milk for my corn flakes! I would recommend this place to any travellers to Sydney who want clean, well-equipped accomodation with friendly service, near the city centre, at a fair price.

HotelInfo.Name: Y Hotel City South
HotelInfo.Address: 179 Cleveland St, Chippendale, Sydney, New South Wales 2008, Australia (Formerly Noah Lodge)
